Asia visit my website again and I can correlate those two visits because no
one else is going to have the same last 64 bits of that address that's an Ever cookie you can't

segment so that message sent out from your router saying hey I can route your

size header with big spaces for the large source and Des address followed by the
data but you can put extension headers in between the original header and the data to convey different options to the
routers along the path and the reason these extension headers are a problem is you can have multiple of them and they
can result in a packet being fragmented when a packet is fragmented like this the TCP header winds up in the
second fragment that's the header with the port information that's needed for your firewall
so what this means is that according to the IPv6 spec stateless firewall
filtering is impossible your firewall has to keep track of the packet fragments or drop potentially legitimate
traffic now there are talks about restricting the spec so this isn't an issue but until then we're still going
to have to test the firewalls and see how they handle this fragmented traffic you know do they let things um do they
automatically drop fragments which would be the safest but potentially could break things uh do they do stateful
filtering which could open up a denial of service attack or do they default allow fragments through which would be
the most dangerous and another thing that you're going to have to deal with on the
perimeter and internally is the transition and the translation mechanisms so a transition mechanism
allows two IPv6 Islands to talk to one another and this is important because you're going to wind up with an ipv

uh and translation on the other hand lets IPv6 talk to ipv4 and vice versa now there are a lot of transition

too so this can allow hosts inside of your network to act as servers and let

back in these DNS requests in fact you can get so much

saying doesn't exist that AT&T doesn't actually exist a sign to reply
stating that well that signed to reply enables a denial of service attack
because I can just keep requesting subdomains that don't exist and make you sign all of those replies that's
computationally expensive so maybe the solution is to have one generic response no record sign
that and return that whenever a subdomain doesn't exist but that doesn't work either
because an attacker who's performing a man-in-the-middle attack can take that signed no record response and give it to
you for any subdomain that he doesn't want you to know about and because it's signed you'll trust it it looks
completely valid so the solution was to sign a range and state that there was no
subdomain between that range so I know that doesn't exist. at&t.com doesn't
actually exist because there is no subdomain between admin. at&t.com and
key server. at&t.com going alphabetically there's nothing between a
and K these responses can be pre-signed and they mitigate both the denial of
service and the man- in the- Middle attack and of course open the information disclosure issue I can
enumerate all the subdomains for a server by using these range responses
and that's a pretty big concern for a lot of companies and in response a solution was

responses we're seeing a trend of using DNS sec to bootstrap other
protocols so with plain DNS we make a request we get back a response now that
response is authenticated we know it wasn't altered by a man in the middle or Faked by an
impersonator now we're going to start asking for more data than just an IP address for example we'll ask for an SSL

over here and then we're going to go talk to the server over SSL and we'll compare them and make sure that they
match and if they don't match we know that something has gone wrong so we
don't have to just trust the certificate authorities we have two different pki
infrastructures and an attacker would have to subvert both of them to pull off an
attack DNS gives us a generic method to bootstrap the security of other

infrastructure that chain clients can be bootstrapped to talk to you securely by

me over tls1 one and don't run any plugins so if I receive an embed tag
